panels.description:
Shows the average uptime percentage across all selected instances and jobs over the specified time interval. Provides an overall availability metric
  indicating what percentage of time services have been operational, useful for SLA reporting and availability trend analysis.
panels.title: SLO: Service Uptime % [28d]

panels.description:
Shows the average uptime percentage across all selected instances and jobs over the specified time interval. Provides an overall availability metric
  indicating what percentage of time services have been operational, useful for SLA reporting and availability trend analysis.
panels.title: SLO: Service Uptime Percentage [$interval]

panels.description:
Percentage of samples that failed to write to remote storage endpoints out of total samples attempted. High percentages indicate critical issues with
  remote storage connectivity, capacity limits, or configuration problems requiring immediate investigation to prevent data loss.
panels.title: SLI: Remote Storage Failed % [28d]

panels.description:
Percentage of samples that failed to write to remote storage endpoints out of total samples attempted. High percentages indicate critical issues with
  remote storage connectivity, capacity limits, or configuration problems requiring immediate investigation to prevent data loss.
panels.title: SLO: Remote Storage Failed Percentage [$interval]

panels.description:
Percentage of samples currently pending in write queues relative to total samples being processed by remote storage endpoints. High percentages indicate
  storage throughput issues, network congestion, or capacity constraints causing write backlogs that may lead to memory pressure and potential data loss.
panels.title: SLI: Remote Storage Pending % [28d]

panels.description:
Percentage of samples currently pending in write queues relative to total samples being processed by remote storage endpoints. High percentages indicate
  storage throughput issues, network congestion, or capacity constraints causing write backlogs that may lead to memory pressure and potential data loss.
panels.title: SLO: Remote Storage Pending Sample Percentage [$interval]

panels.description:
Shows the average uptime percentage across all selected instances and jobs over the specified time interval. Provides an overall availability metric
  indicating what percentage of time services have been operational, useful for SLA reporting and availability trend analysis.
panels.title: Average Service Uptime Percentage

panels.description:
Shows instances that are currently down or unreachable. Displays services with availability less than 100%, indicating failed health checks, network
  connectivity issues, or service outages. Critical for monitoring overall system availability across selected instances and jobs.
panels.title: Service Availability Status

panels.description:
Shows the total number of active time series currently stored in Prometheus TSDB head block across selected instances. Indicates cardinality and memory
  usage, helping monitor data ingestion scale and identify potential performance impacts from high-cardinality metrics.
panels.title: Total Active Time Series

panels.description:
Shows the total number of chunks currently held in Prometheus TSDB head block memory across selected instances. Indicates memory usage for recent time
  series data and helps monitor storage efficiency and potential memory pressure from data ingestion.
panels.title: Total Active Chunks in Memory

panels.description:
Heatmap showing the frequency distribution of time taken to send data batches to remote storage endpoints. Color intensity represents the rate of batches
   completing within each duration bucket, helping identify performance patterns and latency outliers in remote storage operations.
panels.title: Remote Storage Batch Duration Distribution

panels.description: Tracks remote storage health with pending samples awaiting transmission, failed operations, and retry attempts across clusters. Rising values indicate storage performance issues or connectivity problems requiring investigation.
panels.title: Remote Storage Health Metrics

panels.description: Rate of failed, pending, and retried samples sent to remote storage over 5-minute intervals. High values indicate storage connectivity issues, capacity constraints, or performance degradation requiring immediate attention.
panels.title: Remote Storage Error Rate

panels.description: Complete view of remote storage operations including successful writes, retries, pending samples, and failures over 5-minute intervals. Provides comprehensive throughput analysis for capacity planning and performance monitoring.
panels.title: Remote Storage Throughput

panels.description:
Total number of rule evaluation iterations that were completely missed over the specified interval due to severe performance issues or system resource
  constraints. Critical indicator of alerting system reliability problems that could result in delayed or missing alerts.
panels.title: Rule Evaluation Iterations Missed [$interval]

panels.description:
Total number of rule evaluation iterations that were skipped over the specified interval due to slow evaluation times or system overload. Indicates
  performance issues with alerting and recording rules that may cause delays in alert firing or missed rule executions.
panels.title: Rule Evaluation Iterations Skipped [$interval]

panels.description:
Total count of scrapes that exceeded the configured sample limit over the specified interval across selected targets. Indicates targets producing
  excessive metrics volume, which can impact Prometheus performance and may require sample limit tuning or metric reduction.
panels.title: Sample Limit Exceeded Count [$interval]

panels.description:
Total number of failed attempts to reload the Prometheus time series database configuration over the specified interval. Indicates configuration issues,
  disk problems, or corruption that prevents successful database reloads, requiring immediate attention to maintain data integrity.
panels.title: TSDB Reload Failures [$interval]

panels.description:
Combined count of all data quality problems during target scraping including samples exceeding limits, duplicate timestamps, out-of-bounds values, and
  out-of-order samples over the specified interval. Provides overall visibility into scraping health and data ingestion reliability issues requiring attention.
panels.title: Total Scrape Data Quality Issues [$interval]

panels.description: Comprehensive timeline of all system failures and errors including connection failures, evaluation issues, service discovery problems, and data quality issues. Use this view to correlate errors across different system components and identify patterns.
panels.title: System Error Timeline

panels.description: Service availability status over time showing 1 for up and 0 for down. Stacked view allows monitoring multiple instances simultaneously to identify availability patterns and outages.
panels.title: Service Availability Timeline

panels.description: Number of memory chunks currently held in the TSDB head block for each instance. High values may indicate memory pressure or inefficient data retention policies.
panels.title: TSDB Memory Usage by Instance

panels.description: Total number of active time series currently stored in the TSDB head block for each instance. Indicates current cardinality and memory usage.
panels.title: Active Time Series by Instance

panels.description: Rate of time series creation and removal over 5-minute intervals. High churn rates may indicate frequent service restarts, dynamic labeling, or short-lived metrics requiring optimization.
panels.title: Time Series Churn Rate

panels.description: Shows the rate at which new metric samples are being ingested into the Prometheus TSDB per instance. Higher rates indicate increased monitoring load and may require capacity planning for storage and memory resources.
panels.title: Data Ingestion Rate by Instance

panels.description: Cumulative count of target synchronization operations executed for each scrape job. Frequent sync operations may indicate dynamic service discovery environments or configuration changes.
panels.title: Target Synchronization Count by Job

panels.description: Average time taken to synchronize targets for each scrape job in milliseconds. High durations may indicate service discovery performance issues or network latency affecting target updates.
panels.title: Target Sync Duration by Job

panels.description: Time taken to scrape individual targets in seconds. High values may indicate target performance issues, network latency, or large metric volumes requiring optimization.
panels.title: Individual Scrape Duration by Instance

panels.description: Breakdown of data quality issues during scraping including samples exceeding limits, duplicate timestamps, out-of-bounds values, and out-of-order samples. These issues can indicate target configuration problems or data corruption.
panels.title: Data Quality Issues by Type

panels.description: Average time taken to evaluate alerting and recording rules in milliseconds. High durations may indicate complex rules, high cardinality data, or system resource constraints affecting alerting performance.
panels.title: Rule Evaluation Performance by Instance

panels.description: Rate of HTTP requests by handler endpoint in microseconds. Useful for identifying high-traffic API endpoints and monitoring query performance across different handlers.
panels.title: API Request Rate by Handler

panels.description: Cumulative query execution time broken down by query engine stages (prepare, queue, eval, result_sort). Helps identify bottlenecks in query processing pipeline.
panels.title: Query Engine Performance by Stage

panels.description: Comprehensive view of rule evaluation system performance showing total evaluations, missed evaluations due to slow processing, and skipped evaluations due to system throttling. Critical for monitoring alerting reliability.
panels.title: Rule Evaluation System Health

panels.description: Rate at which alert notifications are being sent to external systems like Alertmanager. Low or zero rates may indicate alerting pipeline issues or notification delivery problems.
panels.title: Alert Notification Rate by Instance

panels.description: Time elapsed since the last successful configuration reload in minutes. High values may indicate configuration update issues or failed reload attempts requiring investigation.
panels.title: Configuration Freshness by Instance

panels.description: Binary indicator showing whether the last configuration reload was successful (1) or failed (0). Values of 0 indicate configuration problems that need immediate attention.
panels.title: Configuration Reload Status by Instance

panels.description: Rate of garbage collection operations over 2-minute intervals. High GC rates may indicate memory pressure or inefficient memory usage patterns affecting overall system performance.
panels.title: Garbage Collection Activity by Instance
